alert.note: Alert for Kodiak Island (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued March 22 at 11:00AM AKDT until March 22 at 6:00PM AKDT by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM AKDT THIS EVENING FOR WESTERN AND SOUTHERN PORTIONS OF KODIAK ISLAND... * WHAT...Snow and blowing snow expected. Additional snow accumulations of 2 to 4 inches with expected. Winds gusting as high as 50 mph in combination with falling and blowing snow will reduce visibilities to one half mile at times. * WHERE...Communities along the western and southern portions of Kodiak Island, including Larsen Bay, Karluk, Akhiok, and Old Harbor. * WHEN...Until 6 PM AKDT this evening. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Areas of blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. Strong winds could cause tree damage. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Strong westerlies and snow is expected over the southern and western portions of the Island through 3 pm this afternoon before lifting to the northern portions later in the afternoon. Kodiak City may see blowing snow conditions for a brief period from 3pm to 6pm.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. For the latest road conditions call 5 1 1 or visit 511.alaska.gov.
